biography.bio: Glenn Tryon was born on August 2, 1898 in Julietta, Idaho, USA as Glenn Monroe Kunkel. He was an actor and writer, known for Lonesome (1928), Broadway (1929) and Along Came Auntie (1926). He was married to Jane Frazee and Lillian Hall. He died on April 18, 1970 in Orlando, Florida, USA.
biography.name: Glenn Tryon

biography.bio: Merna Kennedy was born on September 7, 1908 in Kankakee, Illinois, USA as Maude Kahler. She was an actress, known for The Circus (1928), Red-Haired Alibi (1932) and Broadway (1929). She was married to Forrest Brayton and Busby Berkeley. She died on December 20, 1944 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Merna Kennedy

biography.bio: E.J. Ratcliffe was born on March 10, 1863 in London, England as Edward J. Ratcliffe. He was an actor, known for The Black Pirate (1926), In the Palace of the King (1915) and The Winning of Barbara Worth (1926). He was married to Eleanor Scott L'Estelle. He died on September 28, 1948 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: E.J. Ratcliffe

biography.bio: Burr McIntosh born William Burr McIntosh in Ohio in 1862. Son of the President of public utility and Cleveland Gas Coal Company William Ambrose. Burr was educated at Lafayette College in Princeton where he became a member of the Sigma Chi fraternity in 1884. became a star on Broadway stage, perhaps his best known stage role was in 'Trilby' in 1905. Hefty, bald, intelligent man who starred and supported in many drama and comedy films, his first was the starring role Jo Vernon in Lawrence B McGill's 'In Maizzouri' for the All Star Feature Film Co in 1914, he's perhaps best remembered as Squire Bartlett in D.W. Griffith's 'Way Down East' starring Lillian Gist in 1920, also appeared in many early talkies including his last 'The Richest Girl in the World' starring Miriam Hopkins for the RKO Film Co in 1934. during the 1930s he devoted himself to charitable causes, particalarly collecting toys for poor families. He his also known for publishing a well-known magazine (Burr McIntosh Monthly) and a lecturer characterizing himself as 'The Cheerful Philosopher' also a film production owner, author, reporter and pioneering radio actor. He died from a heart attack in Hollywood in 1942 age 80
biography.name: Burr McIntosh

biography.bio: Lloyd Whitlock was born on January 2, 1891 in Springfield, Missouri, USA. He was an actor, known for The Lucky Texan (1934), West of the Divide (1934) and The Hurricane Express (1932). He was married to Myrtle Gibsone. He died on January 8, 1966 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Lloyd Whitlock

biography.bio: William Welsh was born on February 9, 1870 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA as William Joseph Welsh. He was an actor, known for 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea (1916), The Shock (1923) and Traffic in Souls (1913). He died on July 16, 1946 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: William Welsh

biography.bio: Kathleen Kerrigan was born on April 11, 1868 in New Albany, Indiana, USA. She was an actress and writer, known for The World Aflame (1919), Samson (1914) and The Uplifters (1919). She was married to Clay Clement. She died on January 27, 1957 in San Fernando, California, USA.
biography.name: Kathleen Kerrigan

biography.bio: Frederick Lee is an actor, known for The Twin Triggers (1926), The Ramblin' Galoot (1926) and Thundering Through (1925).
biography.name: Frederick Lee

biography.bio: Jack 'Tiny' Lipson was born on January 17, 1901 in Denver, Colorado, USA. He was an actor, known for Flash Gordon (1936), The Stunt Man (1927) and The Eyes Have It (1928). He died on November 28, 1947 in Madera County, California, USA.
biography.name: Jack 'Tiny' Lipson

biography.bio: Edna Marion was born on December 12, 1906 in Chicago, Illinois, USA as Edna Hannam. She was an actress, known for Flying Elephants (1928), Powdered Chickens (1925) and Busy Lizzie (1927). She died on December 2, 1957 in Hollywood, California, USA.
biography.name: Edna Marion

filmingLocations.location: Universal Studios - 100 Universal City Plaza, Universal City, California, USA
